Comment: This was a game in an annotation tournament, and it turned into something of a marathon! Although it is "only a draw" is not without interest!

I castle. With the a2 pawn on a4, there just isn't enough pawn cover on the queen side. As my king has to go to g1, I may as well put it there now.

played with the idea of playing e3-e4 at some stage.

Like now! Post-match gameknot computer analysis says we are out of the books and black is 0.15 ahead. I am not convinced, looks pretty level to me. It was played in Portisch, Lajos (2650) vs. Smyslov, Vassily (2545) in 1981 and Black won in 41, http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=x69837&mv=21&rnd=0.6795143269890982
but I think one can improve on White's play, for instance instead of 13. g3 perhaps White can try g4. A couple of Gameknot games continued with 11. e4 O-O 12. g4 Ne8 13. Ng2 Bg6 14. Qb3 a5, both draws.

His Qb6 attacked along the b6-g1 diagonal. As my king lies at the end of that diagonal, I decided to move it out of the way, and unpin my d pawn.
